那么我就从这部游戏开始养成写评测的好习惯吧！！！就当是游戏给我的礼物。自己写给自己看哈哈哈哈。

《生化奇兵：无限》一杯名叫第九艺术的溶液和一些名叫美国的溶剂

对于一个刚刚结束高考的宅心仁厚的普通青年来说，只有游戏能填满时间的真空，于是，上了G胖这条贼船。
今年九月份购买了我的第一个游戏，作为一个对单机游戏并不太了解的游戏体验者，连爱好者都提不上，在一系列的游戏体验中越陷越深，生化奇兵这游戏是我十一月买的，然而是第一款通关的游戏……所以这也就是我的第一篇真正的评测了。

为什么要写评测呢？因为我实在想把自己的游戏体验直观表达出来，以一个完全不专业的眼光去看一个游戏，以文字记录一个人的游戏体验实在是有成就感的而且趣味十足，但为什么要写这么详细以至于有很多废话呢？

因为我闲啊。

====================================================================================

无限是我接触的第一部BS作品。
我的游戏阅历有限，但直觉告诉我这是一部相当复杂的游戏，复杂在于它的元素，它是一部鲜艳的游戏。
在我看来它是特立独行的，和其他FPS相比，它的鲜艳不止表现在美术风格，还有叙事，还有它想探讨的东西。

无限真的很美国。可能这就是它流光溢彩的原因。就像美利坚本身的熔炉形态，无限也呈现一种与之对应的形状，我觉得这游戏的精神内核就是美国的内核，它所展现的那种强烈的矛盾感，那种混乱，那种病态的和神圣的和理性的，或者表面神圣实际病态，或者表面疯狂实际理性的那一箩筐思想，信念，欲望和希望，都是美国历史发展的产物。尤其是结局，渴望救赎的德维特，和邪恶反派康斯托克竟然是同一个人，而实现救赎的方式竟然是杀死自己。

动手的是他女儿，即他自己的子嗣。
细思极恐啊。

游戏的结局首先让我想到全金属外壳的Born to kill那句话，库布里克通过他的电影揭示了人性的双重矛盾，美国的历史也正是这样，光荣伴随鲜血，哥伦比亚的居民就像当初五月花号上的清教徒，以上帝之名，进行残酷的向更高的文明目标建设的步伐。主角与康斯托克是同一个人想必这也是对美国历史的一种暗喻。而且更有意思的是，受洗的康斯托克竟然凭借畸形的信念成为了乌托邦的王，他合理化过去并以上帝的名义救赎着自己，而拯救的方式则是毁灭哥伦比亚的母亲，美国，这一罪恶之地，他使哥伦比亚成为悬在美国头上的达摩克利斯之剑，把自己神化为达摩克里斯式的英雄，穆罕默德式的先知，但不可否认，康斯托克已经成为了一个伟人，而未受洗的德维特因内疚和悔恨成为一个社会的边缘人，这是否意味美国梦本身的异化，或者说美国社会支持任何目的和形式的推动，只要这能让国家更强大，而排斥一切停滞，资本主义大生产带来的这种意识形态，解构来说就是拜金，科学迷信和利益至上，高度的民族主义，理想主义。哥伦比亚陷入修昔底德陷阱便开始资本扩张，而这些都是理所应当的，因为它的生产力超越了时代，极端思想加高生产力使哥伦比亚必将走向扩张的道路。

政治显然只是BSI讨论的其中一个话题，但我还是想继续写。人民之声象征社会矛盾，也相当激进，极右与极左在天堂开战，这是两种殊途同归的理想，当然，在任何一个极权国家都酝酿着革命，这无可厚非。但我立刻发现，哥伦比亚自身也扮演着一个推翻者的角色，整部游戏都贯穿着反叛，子代对父代的叛逆，美国就是这么诞生的。然而最恐怖的是伊丽莎白对德维特的谋杀，德维特是否自愿先不说，子嗣对父辈的屠戮就是骇人的，是否德维特必须要死？是否有一定要杀他的必要？还是说这只是一种高度象征的仪式，是伊丽莎白实现彻底自由和复仇的一个借口。天知道伊丽莎白是否也已经扭曲。当初刚从高塔逃出的她是纯洁天真的，而之后这一切的转变直观表现出现实对人的塑造力，这也是一种控诉。而这一切都可以归总到美国这两个字。

繁荣是现在，是表象，罪恶是过去，但也确实存在，必须直面历史并找到理性的发展方式，以免陷入独裁的深渊和矛盾的泥潭，走上大英帝国的老路，恐怕这是BSI政治童话里的寓意。而更形而上的释义，我也揣摩不清，而对于这些难以名状的恐怖，躁动，优雅和庄严，我们只需概括为American就好。

OK，就写这么多。

God bless America

惊艳！这是我对BIOSHOCK三部曲的最后一作的最大体会。
  从灯塔升入天空之城哥伦比亚的那一瞬间，整个人都被震撼了。不同于前两作海底城市销魂城的阴沉，哥伦比亚鲜艳、明亮，给人以眼前一亮的感受；蒸汽朋克与超越时代科技的结合，不仅不显得矛盾，更体现出了哥伦比亚无法复制的美。
  布克、伊丽莎白、康姆斯托克，三个看似毫不相关的人物，通过剧情的发展，抽丝剥茧，还原了一个震撼到你的关系。一个出乎意料的结尾，诠释了标题，也带给玩家一声叹息。
  DLC海葬一、二，从剧情上连接了三代作品，从销魂城到哥伦比亚再回到销魂城，一切像一个封闭的圈，最后回到开始的地方，完美闭幕。
  来吧，体验一次BIOSHOCK系列带给你的完美惊艳吧！

You're probably thinking to yourself, "What environment could be as visually interesting and immersive as Rapture?" Enter Columbia, a floating city in the clouds where everyone is having a great time celebrating their heritage....of unyielding patriotism and racism. As a fan of the first game and its unique environment, I skipped over the second game at first to play this one, and I'm glad I did. The game mechanics were vastly improved and expanded to include really neat Vigors that help you combat your way through citizens of Columbia who are not too pleased to see you, and you'll find out why. The storyline has twists and turns and keeps your attention as you fight your way to Comstock, the man, the myth, the legend. The graphic environment of this game is wonderful and true to the time period, and even when enterable shops didn't have items, I couldn't help but look around at the little details that were put in. I didn't find gameplay overly difficult and the amount of ammo laying around makes it almost impossible to run out completely unless you're going ham on enemies, which some of them feel like you have to. Overall, this game was very enjoyable to play and experience.

BioShock Infinite
by Irrational/2K Games
Genre: FPS
Release: March 15, 2013

-----

"Will the circle be unbroken, by and by... by and by? Is a better home awaiting in the sky, Lord, in the sky?"

The last whole chapter in the BioShock series so far, Infinite has us taking to the clouds in the Edwardian era (1912, actually), as the last great expression of American exceptionalism shines like both a shining jewel… and a blinding light.

You are disgraced Pinkerton Detective Booker DeWitt. You’ve run up a bunch of debts in your life, and now the bill is coming due. Fortunately, an enigmatic pair, a brother and sister named the Luteces, employ you for one final job…

“Bring us the girl, and wipe away the debt!”

Rosalind and Robert send you to the floating city of Columbia, to retrieve a young woman by the name of Elizabeth. She’s apparently being held captive somewhere in the city. Seems a very simple job…

It turns out to be anything but. Elizabeth is being used in a very dark manner. See, she has very special powers; she can generate what have come to be called tears in the fabric of reality. From gateways to the past or the future, to wholly original scenarios of her own imagining – if she can think it, she can open a tear to it. Her power is such that her very existence is used to power much of Columbia!

Well, her captor, Zachary Hale Comstock, is the Founder (and the leader of the Founders faction!) of Columbia, and he won’t be letting Elizabeth go without a fight. His minion, or pet, the enigmatic Songbird, is strangely (and quite familiarly, for those who’ve played the first two games!) pair-bonded to Elizabeth…

Anyway, this is a GREAT FPS, with a more linear story in the vein of BioShock 2, than the freely backtracking form of the first game. When you liberate Elizabeth, she can help you during the many pitched battles in the game, throwing you health, ammo and even new weapons when you run low. She can pick locks, giving access to secrets! And in some instances, she can cause new items to come into existence to assist in the tougher battles!

The other prominent faction in Columbia, besides the Founders, is the Vox Populi, run by Daisy Fitzroy. She and Vox represent the lower classes, while the Founders are the upper. A power struggle between them exists, much like between Columbia and the rest of the world – Columbia ‘emancipated’ itself from the United States at some point in the past. The Founders believe they are superior in all ways to the Vox and that they must be crushed, just as they wish to forcefully bring their light to the rest of the world.

For the rest of this intriguing story, you’ll just have to play the game! I highly recommend it to all FPS fans, as well as those who loved the first two games as I did!

说实话这么多年来游戏也玩过不少了，无论出名的或是不出名的，正版的还是盗版的，也只有这款游戏最深的打动了我，许多观点，被用游戏的这种方式表现了出来，仅对于我个人而言，玩游戏大多数时候是为了体验剧情，这款游戏的剧情我给满分，因为相对于其他所有的游戏来说，他讲了一个很成功的，不肤浅的故事，他没有把所有的东西都交代清楚，更多的东西留给玩家思考，揣摩，甚至猜测，但这也正是这款游戏出彩的地方，不如说，我们以游戏的方式，看完了一部电影，我们不是主角，玩家不做选择，我们是看客，是旁观者，我们不改变不毁灭一个世界，我们是他的一部分。本作的感情线，或许在许多人看来是硬伤，但我觉得模糊的一切把真正的感情深化了，纯粹了。我还是说，游戏性不高，是因为本作属于电影的程度大于游戏。总而言之，这款游戏让我回味，让我不时想起而会心一笑，Mr.DeWitt,give me the girl and your debt will be paid off.This is your redemption.

Oyundan ziyade bir görsel şölen veya içinde bulunduğumuz bir film gibi düşünmek daha doğru olur. Konusu diğer bioshock oyunlarıyla bağlantılı olmayan bambaşka bir hikayeyle gelen bu oyun(spoiler içeren kısımda biraz daha derinlenmesine gireceğim) gerçekten oynanması gerekenler arasında. Oyun genel hatlarıyla optimizasyonu çok iyi,grafik ve kaplamaları çok yerinde ve yaratmış oldukları dünyayla insanı mest ediyor; adeta bir masal tadında bir dünya sunuyor. Oyunun artıları;

+Optimizasyon çok sağlam(benim çöp bilgisayarımda bile çok rahat 60-70 FPS aldım)
+Konusu mükemmele yakın güzellikte
+Grafikler gerçekten çok tatlı ve güzel
+Silah çeşitliliği yerinde
+Çeşitli askerlerle klasik fps sıkıcılığı yaşatmıyor(her gelen düşman için farklı tarzda veya silahla oynamanız gerekiyor)

eksilere geldiğimizde burası biraz daha fazla madde içerecek :)

-Sürekli olarak mermi sıkıntısı çekiyorsunuz(zorda oynadığım için bunu yaşamış da olabilirim)
-Sürekli haritada para can veya cephane aramak zorundasınız yoksa silah yükseltmeleri yapamıyor ve sanki silahınız boncuklu tabancaymış gibi hissiyat yaratıyor
-Vigor denilen özel güçler eğer kolayda oynuyorsanız çok gereksiz. Zorda oynadığım zaman sadece çok faydasını gördüm diyebilirim
-Bu mükemmel senaryoyu anlayabilmek için gene sağda solda gezip ses kayıtlarını bulmanız lazım. Neden direkt bana vermiyorsun olay örgüsünü be kardeşim ?
-Olay örgüsünde gözümüze sokulan sabitler ve değişkenler konusunu açıklama gereksinimlerinde bulunmuyorlar ve gerçekten bunu anlamak için çok gezmeniz ve oyun dışı araştırma yapmanız gerekiyor.

Игра Bioshock Infinity поражает бесконечностью выбора, однако это ведет к одному - к смерти главного героя. Пончалу вы играете в мире, похожем на рай, но столкнувшись с предрассудками этого мира, которые  созданы  элизабет или её матерью вы становитесь главным антогонистом этого мира. Вас считают лжепророком. Однако ваш антогонист побеждает в это мире и вы вынудены пойти в альтернативную вселенную, чтобы исправить ситуацию, но вы попадаете в антимир, где вы герой, но герой кооторый умер. Этим вы вызываете недоумение у черной части общества.
Сюжет сложный и понравится людям, которые хотят поглубже окунуться в мир мультевселенной. Скорее всего эта игра будет по вкусу фанатам Рика и Морти. Так же стоит отметить красоту и опасность Элизабет, за которую я хотел бы поиграть, но пока не могу.
Хочется отметить дух 20 годов и проблемму рассизма в Bioshock Infinity. К сожалению эти проблеммы не исчезли и по сей день, однако культура с тех пор изменилась. Крайне рекомендую поиграть в данную игру.

一开始我就知道 布克是康姆斯托克，安娜德威克（AD）就是伊丽莎白。
并且全程以此带入游戏。
而对于剧情
从伤膝河战役的背景 到交出安娜 最后被安娜淹死在水里的救赎
开始游戏之前都有一个大概的了解。

简单的解读一下剧情吧 可能有些差错 欢迎指正
一开始 布克作为伤膝河战役的老兵 对于这场大屠杀深感愧疚（同时这场大屠杀在历史上确有其事
于是 神父来到了这些老兵身边  对他们进行宗教洗礼
布克拒绝了 并且对伤膝河大屠杀一直念念不忘 无法原谅自己 
于是酗酒 打赌 沉沦以后签下了一堆债。
在另一个世界线 布克接受了洗礼 抛弃了过去的自己，成为了康姆斯托克。
之后再罗莎琳的帮助下建立天使之城--天空之城哥伦比亚。再之后，罗莎琳发现了时间机器，能够穿越时间和空间。以此哥伦比亚的科技迅速发展，康姆斯托克成为了先知。
时间机器的副作用让康姆斯托克加速老化 最后失去生育能力，只能利用钱财从另一个世界欠债巨大的布克手里买走安娜作为继承人。 （最后抱走安娜的桥段伊丽莎白也带着玩家看到了。）布克后悔 安娜的小指头留在了另一个世界 获得穿越时空的能力。
康姆斯托克发现了这点 用虹吸装置把她困在笼子里，用夜莺看管，改名伊丽莎白。又通过时间机器发现布克后悔地把AD（安娜德威克的缩写）磕到手上 ，担心他来救伊丽莎白 于是把他称为伪牧羊人。把自己称作牧羊人，把伊丽莎白称为羊羔。在宗教的作用下 康姆斯托克的思想很快传遍了哥伦比亚。布克被全哥伦比亚通缉 。和美国反目成仇后，康姆斯托克用宗教的力量把哥伦比亚战争堡垒（战争堡垒在丑化清朝那里有说明）开向了世界，成为了名副其实的破坏者。（最后康姆斯托克飞艇上清空空轨的时候你会发现丢下去的都是导弹）这时候世界已经奈何不了哥伦比亚浮空城了。
罗伯特和罗莎琳（两者是不同世界的同一个人）找到布克，希望他阻止康姆斯托克。于是布克随他们前往哥伦比亚（游戏开始的灯塔剧情）但是布克忘记了要救回安娜，记忆的混乱让他把赌债之事和救回安娜混在了一起，变成了救回女孩还赌债。
以上是背景 游戏在此正式展开。
之后的剧情就是游戏里体验的了。
拯救伊丽莎白，前往纽约被伊丽莎白发现，被人民之声俘虏，伊丽莎白被夜莺抓走，见到老年的伊丽莎白，拯救伊丽莎白，击杀康姆斯托克，摧毁虹吸装置。
值得一提的是，黛西菲兹罗伊和康姆斯托克夫人。菲兹罗伊是康姆斯托克夫人的女仆，康姆斯托克发现夫人对他对于伊丽莎白的真相的隐瞒的不满（知道伊丽莎白不是康姆斯托克的亲生子嗣），为了让伊丽莎白坐上宝座，康姆斯托克杀死了夫人，并且嫁祸给菲兹罗伊。菲兹罗伊最后建立人民之声叛军，和哥伦比亚展开对峙。（布克被菲兹罗伊要挟后，经历的几个世界线，大背景没有什么区别，只是人民之声，有的世界线公然宣战，有的还是蓄势待发此类），最后布克进入一个自己加入人民之声并成为抗军英雄死亡的世界（进入自己已经死亡的世界会流鼻血）。此后即将离开时为了保护布克，伊丽莎白被夜莺带走，布克看到未来，从老伊丽莎白那里拿到了夜莺的控制方法。最后进入康姆斯托克的飞艇，击杀了康姆斯托克。
最后摧毁了虹吸装置，伊丽莎白获得了全部力量，召唤海压破坏了夜莺，带领布克走向真相。

大致就是这些。
而对于游戏性来说，生化奇兵无限，在我心里不会有太高的分数。
枪械手感和打击感蜜汁不爽，一波扫射就需要满地找弹药的枪械。（枪法硬伤）（个人配置 突击枪/机枪/连发枪+卡宾枪 前期用奔腾野马后期用乌鸦 打爱国者用电极 打巨人用触手加电击）好在伊丽莎白总是在残血的时候给你一罐血瓶 没子弹的时候给你一把满弹药的枪。比某些一开打就满地跑然后被敌人一下撂倒的npc不知道高到哪里去了。
当然 我简述的只是剧情 。
作为第九艺术的哈姆雷特。
精美的哥伦比亚，震撼的浮空天堂，还有战火纷飞的空中地狱..
宗教独裁，平行宇宙，道德伦理，种族主义，等等引人深思的因素。认真去找一找，能发现很多。
印象最深的一幕，最震憾的一幕是年老的伊丽莎白对着世界。
感触最深的是康姆斯托克被布克杀死在飞艇。一个庞大的无敌帝国的先知，被自己杀死在自己的飞艇上。洒下的重重光辉，绿茵环绕圣洁无暇，和外面战火纷飞千疮百孔的世界的对比...而身后伊丽莎白保护人民的圣母画像更是颇为讽刺。
我不想给它评分。
它是一千个玩家心中的一千个哈姆雷特。

After having replayed this game for maybe the 3rd time I thought that it might be time to drop a review!

First off: 

Is it a good game? Yes! 

Is it a good Bioshock? Nope, at least not in all aspects.


Bioshock Infinite manages to capture your attention immediately with its stunning visuals, story and setting. You're an action hero guy with 20% more backstory trying to find a girl in a floating city around the year of 1900. Art, sound, visuals and voice acting are all top notch, even in 2017. 

The well dosed story unfolds masterfully before and around you while playing through the game, some will like it, others not, but the ways it is conveyed count as a plus for me.

The bummer is, however, that Bioshock Infinite is absolutely boiled down gameplay-wise. Randomly distributed gear around the world make it impossible to have something like a build, weapons are all just firearms and explosives (I miss my spear gun), the only good thing are the powers, called vigors here, that also lack the depth Bioshock players are used to.

Let me give you an example here: In bioshock 1, which was the more basic game in terms of powers, you were able to build for fire and electrical damage, enhancing your powers and certain ammo types (yes, every gun had 3 ammo types that opened up completely new ways of combat). You could even build for basic stealth or  melee only, you could hack and manipulate security systems, set up ambushes or simply troll enemies by charming a big daddy to stomp them into the ground.

One more thing, there is no manual save system, you have to rely on the horrible, frustrating checkpoints that the game gives you, which really ruin the free-roam-ish parts of the game on higher difficulties.

The only thing you can upgrade in Bioshock Infinite are the guns and powers, the gear items do not really enhance them, only provide situational bonuses that are mostly based on RNG, like x% to deal fire damage to an enemy on a melee strike. This might be a consequence of the many revisions they made for the game, but they don't really add much.

If you like a good story, you will get one, but if you like to influence the story, better go replay bioshock 1 and 2. Infinite railroads you through the whole game, you cannot revisit old levels, and every playthrough will likely feel the same. The choices you are given don't really affect the gameplay or outcome.

So, if you want a rather conservative shooter with a good story and fluid gameplay, get this game, now! 

If you want an RPG-shooter mix like the precedessors have been, you will not find a real bioshock here, but still might have if you go into the game without too many expectations in terms of gameplay and variety.

I gladly hand this game 8/10, for being immersive, well constructed and making me want replay it once in a while.

Bioshock 3 is VERY eager to get you into the meat of things. I don't have a strong background into the series but am familiar with its style, and more importantly, its philosophy, and it was quite obvious for me that a newcommer will have a difficult time adjusting to what's coming. This is due to the game's poor beginning. As an idea, what Bioshock 3 wants to achieve works well, but it does so after you've been introduced to story, settings, characters, significant events, conflicts, ect. After all of that, it is an enjoyable experience, not altogether smooth, but quite fun, nonetheless. While they've clearly made a good effort to portray both main protagonist and his companion as living, breathing humans, the way they jump on the adventure together is almost comical to me. It feels like they just needed a glance at each other, and they're all buddy buddy, and if there is some sort of disagreement, they work it out so quickly, they can contest for couple of the milenium. This is quite significant, because it's where the story is weak, and the portrayal of complex characters--thin. I probably would pick flack for that, but it would have been a lot better for the game if it had a choice/consequence heavy dialogue, DA:O type of thing. Together with attitude system, and heck, maybe even skill tree for Elisabeth's snenanigan. The thing tries to sell itself as a FPS, but it isn't. Head shots don't mean a thing, and enemies are very innacurate from afar, while up close, they turn into hit-scans, but more for that later on. Reason why I bring this up: If the game wanted to be a FPS, it should have implemented a different play-style. It does try to be orriginal, fresh and innovative...not unlike it's predecessors I suppose, but it doesn't really bring anything new to the table...much more like it's predecessors. Hence my reason for saying that the game should maybe have utilized a more rpg-heavy dialogue system. Another benefit of such a system would have been that the main protagonist may not have come across as such a mediocre...Rambo...What kind of a guy is that, that can wreck total havoc on a team of fully armed, trained soldiers, with the support of a minigun-wielding robot, and be touched to the depth of his soul by a girl suddenly bursting into (quite fake) tears, all the while having put war, death and his late wife behind him. Bleh! Or what about the girl herself, who makes friend with the first suspicious guy that comes flying through the ceiling of her house, learns that she has been living in isolation from the world and has been observed as a test subject all her life, only to emergy as a happy-go-round Merry Sue literally 5 minutes later...I mean, the reason behind all of this is that Bioshock 3 is so eager to push you into the action. It wants to give you all the vigours, all the weapons, all the upgrades, money, ect., and then throw waves of quite bullet-spongy enemies in front of you. But what about the characters themselves?! Clearly, there has been so much effort into making them good. But because the game wants to pace like a first person shooter, it sort of tries to compress too much of what is going on within their personalities into too little a space. You can't really do that with anything that you want to look human, methinks. The result is this comic impression that I already mentioned that I have about both of the main protagonists. The game plays best with all of that stuff behind you, and DeWitt and Elisabeth just plowing through the futuristic districts of Columbia, unlocking stuff, having small chat, sharing thoughts and impressions, looting lots of loot, shooting lots of enemies, placing lots of tears into place. Then everything comes together. But geez...this thing looks kind of amateurish when it tries to explain things to you.

I mentioned that it tries to sell itself as a first person shooter, but it really isn't. I don't mind how the game tries to approach it's combat, but I think that out of desire to simplify things, it comes up with a rather mediocre and repetitive experience as a result. You can aim weapons, but that is rather pointless. Not only are the majority of the iron sights useless, because of the cartoony art style of the game--thus, making the iron sights in question too large and impractical to be used, but there really isn't a difference in accuracy when we talk about near, far, crouching, jumping, flying, cover, running. Almost all enemies have some sort of neat mobility movement(skill), either a long side-step, or a jump, but you, playing as DeWitt, have nothing of the sorts. You feel like a slug, to be honest. Some weapons can stun enemies, and thank god for that, because when you're fighting multiples in tight spaces, you really cannot have another advantage at your disposal, other than spamming stunning vigours or using weapons that stun-lock them. When in the open, you can stand from afar and pick them one by one with long range weapons(hip fire works better than aiming for that, save the sniper rifle and rpg!), and you will be perfectly fine, because the majority of enemies aren't smart enough to look for cover quickly and/or do an automatic miss from a certain distance onward, with the bizzare exclusion of the granade launcher users, who tend to have that annoyong bot accuracy, but those projectiles move slow, so it's ok. Too many bullet sponges for comfort, to be honest; ammo is plentiful, so it's not too bad. More like a bit annoying when you do a 3 bullet burst at somebody's naked noggin, and they still charge you in for melee strike. Not too bright, but oh well...Bioshock! The combat is at it's best when it's giving you plenty of options to bring in allys with tears and have a lot of mobility freedom with those neat air rails. When you can quickly change positions and disoirient enemies with robots of your own, the combat feels varied and dynamic. Tight spaces and insides of buildings are honestly annoying, and kind of underwhelming, because you don't really have got an advantage when having the initiative. You can't sneak and everybody automatically knows where you are once you open fire.

Graphically the game is mediocre. It does a good job in areas of importance, but neglects a lot of details. There has been a real effort to add a lot of detail to the world, but, perhaps, it was done in a sort of a rush. You will see a lot of low res textures and blocky models, something that other, earlier games don't come even close to. The larger monitor you have, the worse it's gonna look, lol. Effects aren't that good, either. The best model I know of so far is Elisabeth herself, and she looks best when in the dark, LOL! I am not kidding. I know it sounds derogatory...Game has a bit of an optimisation issue with loading areas and such. Nothing major. Don't know why they just didn't add more loading screens. 

While on headphones I was able to appreciate the sound, but when not plugged in, it ended up resembling static noise. I am not very technical when it comes to hardware and what it can give you, but other titles sound a lot better when not on headphones, with added details when plugged in. Bioshock Infinite does not sound well at all when not plugged in. Only through headphones can you really understand how the effects and sound of this game work. 

All in all, a mixed bag across the board. Buy on sale, because of the story-line.

Bioshock Infinite left me with a hole in my heart. You know that feeling, at the end of a great book or movie or TV show or whatever, and for a moment you wonder "wait, is it really over?" And then you try to convince yourself that it's not, and you try to find any way at all to fill that sudden void. I don't know, maybe that feeling's new to you. Play Bioshock Infinite to feel it, I guess.

Rewind. I had heard of Bioshock, knew it was some kind of x-punk techno-fantasy kind of world known for rich story and character development. I never picked it up though because, well, sometimes the time just never feels right to pick something up. I started with Infinite off a whim. The first ten minutes took my breath away. And I spent the next several hours trying to get it back and failing, all the way until the credits rolled their way across the screen.

The music is beautiful. The scenery is beautiful. The dialogue is beautiful. There's a bonding between the setting and the plot that I can't fully explain. I guess this is what people mean by "immersion." Turns out you don't need some avatar you create to be fully immersed, no, all you need are characters you empathize with, who grip you by your mind, your heart, your soul, who rocket into your life from a different world and fade away just as abruptly.

Interlude: the gameplay is technically well-done. I'm not one for FPSs generally, I mean, I'll play one but I'm not very GOOD at it. I wasn't very good at this game either but if Bioshock Infinite does one thing well gameplay-wise, it's offering the player choices. Do you want to run into every encounter guns-blazing? Do you want to stay back and judiciously use spells (ahem, vigors) to crowd control? Do you want to swing around a giant skyline raining bullets from on high before flipping down and sticking the landing with a spinning gear-shiv to the face? Mix and match to your heart's desire. Bioshock Infinite is a series of FPS set pieces with several options per encounter, although I'd say that once you find your groove, it's pretty easy to lock yourself into one way of doing things. Aside from combat, there's a minor exploration component, and this is where the game struggles just a little maintaining its shimmering veneer of immersive world-building. If all you had to do was walk around and explore the beautiful world the creators made for you, that would've been perfect, but for whatever reason the developers insisted on sticking in "collectible bonuses" in little nooks and crannies out of the way of the main plot to reward people for wandering like an aimless lunatic and digging through trash cans. Well, nothing's perfect.

The thing is, this game would be worth playing if it didn't have any gameplay at all. I'm serious. Just experiencing it completely passively would have been enough to make me feel similarly to how I feel now. But there's a certain extra factor gained by the interactivity afforded to the player. The stakes feel real. And Elizabeth, one of my favorite "companion" characters in a long time, by a long margin, feels like a real friend who you want to protect. Like someone with whom to laugh, to live, to cherish every passing moment because you know, one moment, it'll all be over, but God only knows what you'd do without her.

Look, all of this was just to lend some substance to the review so that it'd make sense to you, who has never played the game. But in the end Bioshock Infinite left me with a hole in my heart, and that's what I really felt was worth saying.

Опустим игровой момент и затронем тему мироздания. Нет утверждений и потверждений создания мира, есть теории, законы, правила. Теория бесконечной численности параллельных миров, с бесконечным числом различных действий. Почему мы не можем вмешаться в свою судьбу, чужую, и изменить что-то, взяв из другого, альтернативного мира? 

[h1][b]Завязка и сюжет :[/b][/h1]

Наш главный герой — Букер [spoiler]"Комсток"[/spoiler], вполне наглядное подтверждение тому, чего делать не стоит. Но у всех путей исход один, поэтому все наши действия давно предрешены, даже вмешательство уже предрешено, измена чего-то давно предрешена в другом мире. Так, что же тогда делать? Все довольно просто. Не быть как Букер в своем мире, человеком, который опустившись до дна, решил продать свое дитя. 

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1223395793
В игре весьма запутанный сюжет, что может оттолкнуть большинство геймеров, ищущих красивый шутер, но суть этой истории актуальна и сейчас. Нужно жить ради близких, ради своего будущего. Ведь человек сам строитель, разрушитель, и никто другой, кроме него. 

Сама по себе игра привлекает взор не только историей. С первых шагов в Колумбии бросается эта потрясающая графика. Голубое небо, мягкие лучи солнца, словно мы "застыли" в этом дне. А когда мы бродим по летающему городу, то понимаем, что оказываемся в будущем, но в стиле 80-90-х годов. Конечно, так оно и есть (действия происходят в 1912), но внимательно изучив записи по ходу игры, можно понять, что большинство разработок взято именно из будущего. 

[h1][b]Геймплей :[/b][/h1]

Пройдемся по огромному городу. Нас встречает множество различных магазинчиков: бакалеи, цветочные, фото-салон, бары и клубы. Все веселятся, проводят ярмарки. Гуляя по барам, мы можем услышать этот эксцентричный и заводящий джаз, сразу может вспомниться серия игр как Fallout. От этого просто захватывает дух.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1223109911
Имеется здесь множество видео, аудио хроники. То есть, мы можем полностью узнать историю города, о Пророке. А так ли хорошо живется тут? Мы успели заметить странных людей в белых халатах. По ходу сюжета мы узнаем о том, что есть и противники у Комстока, есть люди, желающие свободы, прав. На минуту можно будет почувствовать дух дикого запада. Наделенная силами Элизабет будет нам помогать в сражениях, открывая различные разрывы во времени. Также, есть одно уникальное изобретение - интересные напитки. Выпивая их, человек получает супер-силу! Огненные шары из рук? Легко! Электричество? Без проблем! И они сыграют неплохую службу нам.

Отмечу разнообразие оружия, ведь это тоже важно в шутерах, не стрелять с одного пистолета. Дробовики, снайперки, автоматы, гранатометы это все есть. И конечно оружие можно модифицировать! Кстати, как и напитки. Наша напарница и в этом подсобит, то монетку найдет, то патроны. Девушка хоть куда. 

[h1][b]Развязка :[/b][/h1]

Думаю, проработаны даже самые маленькие детали. Даже номера банковских ячеек. Не просто размытое изображение с предпологаемыми цифрами. Задумка и воплощение летающего города, обоснованная теория, а не просто "Мы вот сделали так, поэтому летает". Мертвые среди живых, причем понимающие это. То есть, мне просто не к чему придраться. Идеальности и не может быть, но "очень хорошо" бывает. Поэтому, данная игра одна из очень и очень хороших во всем плане.  

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1227946838
И кого же из всех героев мне больше жаль? Букера? Элизабет? Увы. Мне было очень жаль Соловья. Верную и преданную птичку, стремившуюся защитить своего друга... Пусть и предавшего его. 

[b]Общая оценка: 10/10[/b]
